basics.name: Oscar Jaroker
basics.label: Undergraduate Student
basics.summary: My academic preparation includes knowledge of computational mathematics and numerical methods, research experience in combinatorics, and competition experience in math modeling and data analysis. Some of my academic projects include mathematical simulations using MATLAB, Simulink, and R programming.  My academic and professional goals are to work in the fields of physics and engineering.

education.area: Applied Mathematics and Physics with Coursework in Computer Science

work.name: Art of Problem Solving
work.summary: Teaching advanced mathematics to high school students.

work.name: Pfizer Corporate Treasury
work.summary: Financial modeling and analysis of corporate treasury operations.
highlights: Conducted financial research of pharmaceutical industry by coding drug-industry benchmarking program, accessing Bloomberg data through Python API, to compare key company metrics across peer groups
Simulated and reproduced S&P/Moody's credit rating of Pfizer debt to understand the credit rating process
Developed pricing simulator for interest-rate swaps using Bloomberg API and R programming language to understand how interest rate movements might affect Pfizer’s portfolio

Presented results through multiple PowerPoint presentations to Capital Markets, Capital Strategy, Risk Management groups to show how company metrics and potential movements could impact future strategy

work.name: International Ivy Summer Enrichment Program
highlights: Taught Arduino and Makey Makey courses by building off of the existing curriculum to provide half-day instruction to students ages 8-14, developing their collaboration, design, and programming skills
Awarded bonus as a top instructor based on positive feedback from students & parents

awards.title: RIT Physics Olympiad
awards.summary: Won second place out of 23 teams in 2025 and received a cash prize

awards.title: Edwin Foster Kingsbury Prize
awards.summary: Award to students whose performance and promise is 'most outstanding'

awards.title: Deans Award with Distinction
awards.summary: Award to students with a term GPA above 3.6

awards.title: Kean University Hackathon
awards.summary: SetBreach, matching student’s survey responses to colleges using public datasets. Won Most Innovative Project award

volunteer.summary: Founded organization to build interesting engineering innovation by recruiting interested members and working with Colgate Office of Student Involvement and Physics Department
Developed Curricula for Robotics, Python and Java Courses
highlights: Recruited Instructors, Developed Course Schedules, Managed Student Registrations

projects.name: Quantum Computing
projects.summary: Quantum computing is the use of quantum-mechanical phenomena such as superposition and entanglement to perform computation. Computers that perform quantum computations are known as quantum computers.
